resources.string: eCalc is tool to simplify common OpAmp circuit calculations.\n

Vcc: this is the input voltage to the chip in a dual supply configuration.

Vin: the input signal.

R1: the R1 resistor.

Rfb: the feedback resistor.

Gain: the gain of the amplifier. Vin * Gain = Vout

Vout: the amplified output

Vcc: this is the input voltage to the chip in a single supply configuration.

Vin: the input signal.

R1: the R1 resistor.

Rfb: the feedback resistor.

Gain: the gain of the amplifier. Vin * Gain = Vout

Vout: the amplified output

Vcc: The input voltage to the chip in a dual supply configuration.

R1: the R1 resistor.

Rfb: the feedback resistor.

Vhyst: is the hysteresis.

VHth: is the upper switching threshold.

VLth: is the lower switching threshold.

Vcc: The input voltage to the chip in a dual supply configuration.

R1: the R1 resistor.

Rfb: the feedback resistor.

Vhyst: is the hysteresis.

VHth: is the upper switching threshold.

VLth: is the lower switching threshold.

Vcc: The input voltage to the chip in a single supply configuration.

R1: the R1 resistor.

R2: the R2 resistor.

Rfb: the feedback resistor.

Vhyst: is the hysteresis.

Vsw: is the switching voltage

VHth: is the upper switching threshold.

VLth: is the lower switching threshold.
